HXL hashtag chooser

What kind of data do you have in the column?

  • Numbers of people (e.g. census or needs overview)
  • Places
  • Survey or assessment results
  • Humanitarian organisations
  • Humanitarian response (activities, clusters, etc.)
  • Crises or events (e.g. security incidents)
  • Dates
  • Cash or financial information
  • General humanitarian indicators
  • Metadata describing the data row (e.g. source)
  • None of the above
  HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What is the humanitarian context?

  • General population (including those not affected by the crisis)
  • All individuals affected by the crisis
  • All households affected by the crisis
  • All individuals in need of humanitarian assistance
  • All households in need of humanitarian assistance
  • All individuals targeted for humanitarian assistance
  • All households targeted for humanitarian assistance
  • Only individuals actually reached with humanitarian assistance
  • Only households actually reached with humanitarian assistance
Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What is the gender specific gender?

  • All genders are included
  • Female people only
  • Male people only
  • Non-gender-binary people only

So far: #population

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #population

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#population

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#population +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#population +infants

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_0_2 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Start new hashtag

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People killed
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

So far: #affected +ind

Use this hashtag and attributes

#affected +ind +injured +elderly

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_65_ to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #affected +ind +injured +f

Back a step HXL dictionary

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #affected +ind +idps +m

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#affected +ind +idps +m

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#affected +ind +idps +m +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#affected +ind +idps +m +infants

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_0_2 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

Start new hashtag

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People killed
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

So far: #affected +hh

  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #affected +hh +killed +i

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#affected +hh +killed +i

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #affected +hh +idps

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#affected +hh +idps

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

#affected +hh +idps +children

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +ind +killed +f

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +ind +killed +f +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

Start new hashtag

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

  • Female people only
  • Male people only
  • Non-gender-binary people only

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +ind +displaced +m

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +ind +displaced +m +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #inneed +hh +i

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +hh +i

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +hh +i +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

  • Non-gender-binary people only

So far: #inneed +hh +displaced

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #inneed +hh +displaced

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +hh +displaced

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#inneed +hh +displaced +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Start new hashtag

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

So far: #targeted +ind

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_18_64 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +ind +elderly

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_65_ to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #targeted +ind +abducted +m

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +ind +abducted +m

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +ind +abducted +m +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +ind +abducted +m +infants

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_0_2 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +ind +abducted +m +adolescents

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_12_17 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #targeted +ind +refugees +i

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +ind +refugees +i

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +hh +abducted

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +hh +abducted +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

Start new hashtag

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#targeted +hh +refugees +f +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

Start new hashtag

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

So far: #reached +ind

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What is the gender specific gender?

  • All genders are included
  • Female people only
  • Male people only
  • Non-gender-binary people only

New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#reached +ind +injured +m +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Start new hashtag

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #reached +ind +injured +i

  • Female people only
  • Male people only
  • Non-gender-binary people only

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#reached +ind +idps +i +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

What is the humanitarian situation?

  • No, the situation is unspecified
  • People injured
  • People abducted
  • All displaced people (internal or external)
  • Internally-displaced people (IDPs)
  • Refugees

  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #reached +hh +injured

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#reached +hh +injured

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Do the numbers apply only to a specific age group?

  • All ages are included
  • Any children (might include infants or adolescents)
  • Infants only
  • Adolescents only
  • Any adults (might include adolescents or elderly people
  • Elderly people only

So far: #reached +hh +idps +f

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#reached +hh +idps +f

The values should always be numbers

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#reached +hh +idps +f +children

The values should always be numbers. You may also add a custom attribute like +age_5_12 to give a specific range.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of places?

  • Administrative subdivisions (region, country, province, district, etc)
  • Latitude and/or longitude
  • Specific locations (e.g. camps) or mixed types of locations
Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What administrative level?

  • A multi-country region, like West Africa or the Caribbean
  • A country or country-like (admin0) entity
  • A top-level (admin1) subdivision
  • A second-level (admin2) subdivision
  • A third-level (admin3) subdivision
  • A fourth-level (admin4) subdivision
  • A fifth-level (admin5) subdivision
Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Is this location part of a population movement?

  • No, the dataset is not about population movements
  • Yes, it is the origin of a population movement
  • Yes, it is the destination of a population movement
  • Yes, it is a location of asylum

So far: #region

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

How is the location described?

  • By its name
  • By a code

So far: #region

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to identify the language of the content?

  • No, I want to leave it unspecified
  • Yes, the text is in English
  • Yes, the text is in French
  • Yes, the text is in Arabic
  • Yes, the text is in Spanish
  • Yes, the text is in Russian
  • Yes, the text is in Swahili
  • The text is in a language not listed here

So far: #region +name

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Use this hashtag and attributes

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#region +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified

#region +asylum +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified

So far: #region +asylum +code

Back a step HXL dictionary

#region +asylum +code

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

#region +asylum +code +v_pcodes

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Is this location part of a population movement?

  • No, the dataset is not about population movements
  • Yes, it is the origin of a population movement
  • Yes, it is the destination of a population movement
  • Yes, it is a location of asylum

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified
  • Yes, specify ISO3 country codes (like "SYR" for Syria)
  • Yes, specify ISO2 country codes (like "SY" for Syria)

Use this hashtag and attributes

#adm1 +asylum +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified
  • Yes, specify P-codes

So far: #adm1 +asylum +code

Start new hashtag

Is this location part of a population movement?

  • No, the dataset is not about population movements
  • Yes, it is the origin of a population movement
  • Yes, it is the destination of a population movement
  • Yes, it is a location of asylum

So far: #adm2

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified
  • Yes, specify P-codes

So far: #adm3 +asylum +code

Back a step HXL dictionary

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Start new hashtag

Is this location part of a population movement?

  • No, the dataset is not about population movements
  • Yes, it is the origin of a population movement
  • Yes, it is the destination of a population movement
  • Yes, it is a location of asylum

#adm5 +asylum +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified
  • Yes, specify P-codes

So far: #adm5 +asylum +code

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#adm5 +asylum +code

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#adm5 +asylum +code +v_iso3

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#adm5 +asylum +code +v_iso2

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#adm5 +asylum +code +v_pcodes

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of geographic information do you want to tag?

  • Latitude only
  • Longitude only
  • Latitude and longitude together in one field
  • Elevation above sea level

So far: #geo

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#geo +lat

The preferred format for latitude is a decimal value, e.g. "8.5" instead of "8 30.0N".

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#geo +lon

The preferred format for longitude is a decimal value, e.g. "-75.5" instead of "75 30.0W".

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#geo +latlon

The preferred format is the decimal latitude separated by a comma from the decimal longitude, e.g. "8.5, -75.5".

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#geo +elev

The preferred unit is metres above sea level.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of locations are they?

  • Camps
  • Facilities (health, education, etc)
  • Marketplaces
  • None of the above

So far: #loc

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Is this location part of a population movement?

  • No, the dataset is not about population movements
  • Yes, it is the origin of a population movement
  • Yes, it is the destination of a population movement
  • Yes, it is a location of asylum

So far: #loc +camp

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

How is the location described?

  • By its name
  • By a code

So far: #loc +camp

  • Yes, the text is in Arabic
  • Yes, the text is in Spanish
  • Yes, the text is in Russian

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

#loc +origin +name +i_en

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Use this hashtag and attributes

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#loc +origin +name +i_sw

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#loc +origin +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to indicate what code list you are using?

We assume ISO3 for countries and P-codes for administrative subdivisions if unspecified.

  • No, leave it unspecified
  • Yes, specify P-codes

Start new hashtag

What kind of survey/assessment information?

  • Individual respondees (e.g. people, households, or merchants)
  • Capacities (number of beds, maximum cargo, etc)
  • Needs (shelter, communications, etc)
  • Services (healthcare, counselling, etc)
  • Items (food, shelter kits, etc)
  • Some other kind of indicator

CAUTION: survey results are often sensitive data.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of information do you want to provide?

  • A human-readable name
  • A unique machine code
  • A type/classification

What is the most-specific data type that applies to every indicator value?

  • Mixed types, or all text
  • A boolean (true/false or yes/no-style) value
  • A percentage
  • Any other numeric value
  • A web link

So far: #indicator +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#indicator +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE

Don't forget to replace +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE with your own attribute.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#indicator +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE +bool

Don't forget to replace +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE with your own attribute.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Don't forget to replace +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE with your own attribute.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Don't forget to replace +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE with your own attribute.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Are all the organisations tagged playing a specific role?

  • No, there are different roles mixed in the column
  • Yes, they are all donor organisations
  • Yes, they are all programming/extending organisations
  • Yes, they are all implementing partners
  • Yes, they are all organisations making a report

So far: #org

Start new hashtag

What kind of information do you want to provide?

  • A human-readable name
  • A unique identifier
  • A type/classification

So far: #org +funding

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to identify the language of the content?

  • No, I want to leave it unspecified
  • Yes, the text is in English
  • Yes, the text is in French
  • Yes, the text is in Arabic
  • Yes, the text is in Spanish
  • Yes, the text is in Russian
  • Yes, the text is in Swahili
  • The text is in a language not listed here

So far: #org +funding +name

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_en

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_fr

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_ar

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_es

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_ru

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_sw

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +id

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#org +funding +type

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of response information?

  • A cluster or sector
  • A programme, project, or activity
  • A longer description of an activity, project, etc
  • The output or outcome of a humanitarian activity
  • The intended beneficiary/ies
  • The current status of an activity, project, etc.
  • Contact information
Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of sector?

  • A humanitarian cluster
  • Another kind of top-level sector
  • A subsector

So far: #sector

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of information do you want to provide?

  • A human-readable name
  • A unique machine code
  • A type/classification

Start new hashtag

  • No, I want to leave it unspecified
  • Yes, the text is in English
  • Yes, the text is in French
  • Yes, the text is in Arabic
  • Yes, the text is in Spanish
  • Yes, the text is in Russian

Use this hashtag and attributes

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

#beneficiary +name +i_ar

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#beneficiary +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Start new hashtag

What kind of crisis or event?

  • A broad humanitarian crisis/emergency
  • A specific event incident
  • Information about a non-humanitarian group involved an incident
  • Barriers or restrictions on access
  • The cause of an incident
  • The frequency of an incident
  • The severity of an incident
  • An impact of an incident
Back a step HXL dictionary

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of a date is this?

  • Unspecified
  • A start date
  • An end date
  • A specific date when something happened
  • A specific date when something was reported

So far: #date

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#date

The preferred date format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. "2019-04-01". You may also abbreviate to just the month ("2019-04") or just the year ("2019").

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#date +start

The preferred date format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. "2019-04-01". You may also abbreviate to just the month ("2019-04") or just the year ("2019").

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#date +end

The preferred date format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. "2019-04-01". You may also abbreviate to just the month ("2019-04") or just the year ("2019").

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#date +occurred

The preferred date format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. "2019-04-01". You may also abbreviate to just the month ("2019-04") or just the year ("2019").

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#date +reported

The preferred date format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. "2019-04-01". You may also abbreviate to just the month ("2019-04") or just the year ("2019").

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of cash/finance information?

  • An amount of money
  • A monetary currency
  • A modality/method of cash transfer
  • The channel through which money is transferred
Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What type of monetary value is this?

  • Not specified
  • A cash transfer
  • An incoming funding commitment
  • An outgoing funding commitment
  • A budget
  • A disbursement
  • An expenditure

So far: #value

New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#currency +code

Preferred content is ISO 4217 currency codes, such as "CFA" for the West African franc.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

What kind of information do you want to provide?

  • A unique machine code
  • A type/classification

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

Do you want to identify the language of the content?

  • No, I want to leave it unspecified
  • Yes, the text is in English
  • Yes, the text is in French
  • Yes, the text is in Arabic
  • Yes, the text is in Spanish
  • Yes, the text is in Russian
  • Yes, the text is in Swahili
  • The text is in a language not listed here

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#modality +name +i_xx

Replace the "xx" in +i_xx with the two-letter ISO 639 code for your language, e.g. +i_tl for Tagalog.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

How is your overall dataset shaped?

Note that if your dataset contains many columns of indicators, you do not have to tag all of them. Add hashtags only to the columns that people might want to be able to work on using HXL-aware tools.

  • It is wide, with multiple columns of indicator values in each row
  • It is narrow and long, with one indicator value in each row, together with the indicator's name or code

So far: #indicator

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What is the most-specific data type that applies to every indicator value?

  • Mixed types, or all text
  • A boolean (true/false or yes/no-style) value
  • A percentage
  • Any other numeric value
  • A web link

So far: #indicator +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#indicator +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE

Don't forget to replace +MY_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE with your own attribute.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary

  • The indicator's value

Back a step HXL dictionary
Start new hashtag

What kind of row metadata?

  • A unique identifier for the record/row
  • The source of the data
  • A URL for the data in the row
  • Metadata not listed above

So far: #meta

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#meta +id

Assumed to be unique only within the dataset, not globally.

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#meta +source

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#meta +url

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#meta +XXX

Don't forget to replace +XXX with your own attribute.

You can invent any custom attribute you need to describe your metadata, e.g. +certainty

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
New hashtag

Use this hashtag and attributes

#x_???

The core HXL hashtags cannot cover every specialised type of humanitarian data. If you cannot find any match for what you need to tag, you are free to create a custom hashtag beginning with "#x_", e.g. "#x_virulence".

You are free to add more attributes, or to make up your own, if you need to make further distinctions.

Back a step HXL dictionary
